snippet: The data is a painful reminder of how Greece, the weakest member of the euro zone, is chasing a moving target in trying to meet its bailout obligations.
abstract: Greece says its gross domestic product fell 6.2 percent in the second quarter from a year earlier; that follows a 6.5 percent year-over-year contraction in the first quarter.
lead_paragraph: The data is a painful reminder of how Greece, the weakest member of the euro zone, is chasing a moving target in trying to meet its bailout obligations.

headline.seo: Greek G.D.P. Fell 6.2 Percent in 2nd Quarter
headline.main: Greek Economy Shrank 6.2% in Second Quarter
headline.print_headline: Withering Quarter in Greece as Economy Slides 6.2%
